answers.answer: "I am having a pulsation sensation in my 2nd toe of my right foot."I suggest you go see a Podiatrist to rule out muscle or ligament damage, a bone spur, a cyst, and so on. If negative, what comes to mind is Peripheral Neuropathy, possible nerve damage caused by diabetes. An Endocrinologist - PCP's have limited knowledge - can help you to better understand how to manage and control your diabetes. Do you have a home glucose test meter? Test more often to understand where your levels are throughout the day.

question: SInce now over three months I am having a pulsation sensation in my 2nd toe of my right foot. When at first I showed it to my GP he thought I might be developing diabetese. After the blood test his presumtion was right. Since then I am on metformin tablets and even now well after two months my problem is still bothering me. It is not a pain as such but its timing at night keeps in discomfer. Can any one please tell me the probable cause of this. I am stricktly observing a sugar free diet.Thank you
title: Pulsatating in toe
